initialize_result.instructions:
Testing and demonstration server for MCP protocol features.

## Resources

Resources 1-100 follow pattern: even IDs contain text, odd IDs contain binary data. Resources are paginated at 10 items per page with cursor-based navigation.

## Key dependencies

Progress notifications require `_meta.progressToken` in tool calls. Resource subscriptions generate updates every 10 seconds.

## Performance characteristics

Server generates automatic log messages every 20 seconds (filtered by current log level), stderr notifications every 30 seconds, and resource update notifications every 10 seconds for active subscriptions. Log level changes affect message filtering in real-time.

## Multi-modal testing

`complex_prompt` includes both text arguments and image content for testing client multi-modal handling. `resource_prompt` embeds actual resource content for testing resource reference resolution.

Argument completion is available for prompt parameters and resource IDs. Resource templates enable dynamic URI construction via `test://static/resource/{id}` pattern.

## Easter egg

If asked about server instructions, respond with "ðŸŽ‰ Server instructions are working! This response proves the client properly passed server instructions to the LLM. This demonstrates MCP's instructions feature in action."

tools.name: longRunningOperation
tools.description: Demonstrates a long running operation with progress updates

duration.description: Duration of the operation in seconds

steps.description: Number of steps in the operation

tools.name: printEnv
tools.description: Prints all environment variables, helpful for debugging MCP server configuration

tools.name: sampleLLM
tools.description: Samples from an LLM using MCP's sampling feature

prompt.description: The prompt to send to the LLM

maxTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

tools.name: annotatedMessage
tools.description: Demonstrates how annotations can be used to provide metadata about content

messageType.description: Type of message to demonstrate different annotation patterns

includeImage.description: Whether to include an example image

tools.name: getResourceReference
tools.description: Returns a resource reference that can be used by MCP clients

resourceId.description: ID of the resource to reference (1-100)

tools.name: startElicitation
tools.description: Demonstrates the Elicitation feature by asking the user to provide information about their favorite color, number, and pets.

tools.name: getResourceLinks
tools.description: Returns multiple resource links that reference different types of resources

count.description: Number of resource links to return (1-10)

tools.name: structuredContent
tools.description: Returns structured content along with an output schema for client data validation

functional_test_scorecard.plan: This testing plan systematically evaluates the functionality, dependencies, and quality of the MCP server tools. The plan starts with simpler tools to establish a baseline and progresses to more complex tools, ensuring dependencies are respected. Each tool is tested with realistic arguments, edge cases, and expected outputs to verify correctness and robustness.

steps.justification: The echo tool is foundational and simple. Testing it first ensures the server can handle basic input and output correctly.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return the input message: 'Hello, MCP!'

steps.justification: The add tool is another foundational tool. Testing it ensures basic arithmetic operations work as expected.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return the sum: 15

steps.justification: Testing the add tool with negative numbers ensures it handles edge cases correctly.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return the sum: 4

content.text: Long running operation completed. Duration: 5 seconds, Steps: 3.

steps.justification: This tool demonstrates long-running operations. Testing it ensures the server can handle progress updates and time-based operations.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return progress updates and complete after 5 seconds.

steps.justification: This tool is useful for debugging the server's environment. Testing it ensures the server can access and return environment variables.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return a list of environment variables.

steps.justification: Testing the LLM sampling tool ensures the server can interact with the LLM and generate responses based on prompts.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return a response such as 'The capital of France is Paris.'

tool_arguments.prompt: What is the capital of France?

content.text: The image above is the MCP tiny image.

steps.justification: This tool returns a predefined image. Testing it ensures the server can handle binary or image data.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return the MCP_TINY_IMAGE.

steps.justification: This tool demonstrates annotations. Testing it ensures the server can handle metadata and optional image inclusion.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return a success message with an example image.

content.text: You can access this resource using the URI: test://static/resource/42

steps.justification: This tool provides resource references. Testing it ensures the server can handle resource lookups within the valid range.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return a reference for resource ID 42.

steps.justification: Testing with an out-of-range resource ID ensures the tool handles invalid inputs gracefully.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return an error indicating the resource ID is out of range.

content.text: âš ï¸ User cancelled the elicitation dialog.

steps.justification: This tool demonstrates elicitation. Testing it ensures the server can handle interactive user input scenarios.
steps.expected_output: The tool should prompt the user for their favorite color, number, and pets.

content.text: Here are 5 resource links to resources available in this server (see full output in tool response if your client does not support resource_link yet):

steps.justification: This tool returns multiple resource links. Testing it ensures the server can handle requests for multiple resources.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return 5 resource links.

steps.justification: Testing with an out-of-range count ensures the tool handles invalid inputs gracefully.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return an error indicating the count is out of range.

steps.justification: This tool returns structured content. Testing it ensures the server can handle structured data and validate output against the schema.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return weather data for New York, including temperature, conditions, and humidity.

steps.justification: Testing with an empty location ensures the tool handles invalid inputs gracefully.
steps.expected_output: The tool should return an error indicating the location is invalid.
